newsitem.title: USA: Universal says to buy NYC billboard assets.
newsitem.headline: Universal says to buy NYC billboard assets.

text.p: Universal Outdoor Holdings Inc said its Universal Outdoor Inc unit agreed in principle to acquire the outdoor advertising assets of Allied Outdoor Advertising Inc in the New York City metropolitan area for about $51.2 million.

The deal, if consummated, would further evidence the trend toward consolidation in the billboard advertising industry. On Thursday, Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Co agreed to sell its billboard and mall advertising division to Outdoor Systems Inc for $1 billion.
Consummation of the Universal transaction is subject to a definitive agreement and regulatory approvals, it said.
Allied owns and operates about 90 outdoor advertising sign display faces in New York City and New Jersey.
Universal owns and operates approximately 31,000 outdoor advertising displays in the East, Southeast and Midwest.
